channel.title: What type of distribution do you use?
channel.description: What type of distribution do you use? If other, please post. Post why you use that distribution rather than any other distribution.

item.title: What type of distribution do you use?
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

I found these for installing Arch Linux from USB drive:
http://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Usb_Drive_Arch_Install
http://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Install_from_USB_stick

I made my USB drive. Time to test it out.

Read full topic

item.source: What type of distribution do you use?

item.title: What type of distribution do you use?
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

solarwind:

Is there a way to install it if you have no cd drive?

So far this has worked for me and i have not encountered any problems.

I found this out while trying to install vista with no DVD disc.

Firstly you’ll need an .ISO image, depending on what you want i suggest you search: Pirate Bay or any other torrent sites.

Once you have downloaded an .ISO you’ll need a virtual hard drive that’s capable of mounting .ISO’s. For this i used Daemon tools but a quick google search will provide any other software. Make sure they are capable of mounting ISOs though.

Unless you totally want to wipe your computer i suggest you create another partition, if you do not know how, please refer to Ron’s guide. Here

Now that you’ve created a partition, installed the programs you’re ready to go.

Hopefully if you look around your program you’ll find something like this:

When you click that, browse to the .ISO and the installation should begin.

It’s a bit iffy but works.

Read full topic
item.source: What type of distribution do you use?

item.title: What type of distribution do you use?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I’m still using Ubuntu. Love it.
I’m waiting for the next full release of Kubuntu to try it again. I also have Arch Linux CDs on the way just to give it a shot. Didn’t feel like buying some new blanks to burn it to.
Out of all the (_)Ubuntu distros, I’ve always been happiest with Ubuntu.

-Holic

Read full topic
item.source: What type of distribution do you use?

item.title: What type of distribution do you use?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

solarwind:

Is there a way to install it from a USB thumb drive?

I’ve never actually tried, but I suspect if your PC can boot from USB then the normal installer will work fine from it, the image is tiny (like 100mb iirc) so no problems fitting it on pendrives and what not.

Installing isn’t hard, the menu-based installer will get the core packages installed and grub setup and such, you have to manually install Xorg and video drivers, however.

Read full topic
item.source: What type of distribution do you use?

item.title: What type of distribution do you use?
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:190323”][quote author=solarwind link=topic=253778.msg2116920#msg2116920 date=1205812586]

Arch Linux is win.

Is it really that much faster?
[/quote]

I find it a hell of a lot faster on my shit hardware, especially on my Celeron laptop, it flies compared to any other distro I’ve tried on there.

But it’s not all about speed, it’s a really sensible distro all round.[/quote]
I’ll definitely give it a shot after that recommendation.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 17, 2008, 09:43:17 PM[/size][hr]Is there a way to install it if you have no cd drive? Is there a way to install it from a USB thumb drive?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 17, 2008, 10:37:23 PM[/size][hr]So how easy was it installing Arch Linux?

Read full topic

item.title: What type of distribution do you use?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“solarwind, post:4, topic:190323”][quote author=Fasga link=topic=253778.msg2116709#msg2116709 date=1205807975]
Arch Linux is win.
[/quote]
Is it really that much faster?[/quote]

I find it a hell of a lot faster on my shit hardware, especially on my Celeron laptop, it flies compared to any other distro I’ve tried on there.

But it’s not all about speed, it’s a really sensible distro all round.
